content.subject: The standard astrogrid naming authority
content.description: This authority ID will be used to identify generic resources related to the Astrogrid consortium

content.subject: Galexev
content.description: GALAXEV is a library of evolutionary stellar population synthesis models computed using the new isochrone synthesis code of Bruzual and Charlot (2003). This code allows one to computes the spectral evolution of stellar populations in wide ranges of ages and metallicities at a resolution of 3 � across the whole wavelength range from 3200 � to 9500 �, and at lower resolution outside this range.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: OTHERMAGS
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: mags and colours with more filter sets

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: ABMAG
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: AB magnitudes in SDSS filters as function of galaxy Age

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: VEGAMAGS
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: mags and colors (Vega) as function of galaxy Age in standard filters

content.subject: Pegase
content.description: PEGASE is a code which computes the spectral evolution of galaxies. The evolution of the stars, gas and metals is computed according to user selected star formation laws and initial stellar mass function. The stellar evolutionary tracks extend from the main sequence to the white dwarf stage. The emission of the gas in HII regions is also taken into account. The effect of extinction by dust is also modelled using a radiative transfer code.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: GLOBALEXTINCTION
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: 0: No extinction 1: Extinction for a spheroidal geometry 2: Extinction for a disk geometry: inclination-averaged 3: Extinction for a disk geometry: specific inclination

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: SNMODEL
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: model A, B or C of Woosley & Weaver

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: FRACSUB
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Mass fraction of substellar objects formed (real in [0.,1.])

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: CONEVOL
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Consistent evolution of the stellar metallicity (y/n)?

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: INFALLMETAL
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Metallicity of the infalling gas (mass fraction, real in [0.,1.])

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: IMF
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: 1: IMF_Kennicutt.dat 2: IMF_Kroupa.dat 3: IMF_MillerScalo.dat 4: IMF_Salpeter.dat 5: IMF_Scalo86.dat 6: IMF_Scalo98.dat 7: lognormal IMF 8: Rana & Basu (1992) 9: Ferrini (1991)

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: METALICITY
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Metallicity (mass fraction) of the ISM at t=0 (real in [0.,1.])

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: GALWINDAGE
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Age of the galactic winds (Myr, real)

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: SFSCENARIO
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Type of star formation scenario? -2: file giving the SFR and the metallicity -1: file giving the SFR 0: instantaneous burst 1: SFR=p1 from t=0 to p2 2: SFR=p2*exp(-t/p1)/p1 3: SFR=(Mgas^p1)/p2 10 or more: code of the SFR law you have implemented in "spectra.f"

content.subject: SExtractor
content.description: SExtractor is a program that builds a catalogue of objects from an astronomical image. Although it is particularly oriented towards reduction of large scale galaxy-survey data, it performs rather well on moderately crowded star fields.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: CATALOG_NAME
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: The catalogue of images derived from the input images

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: MASK_TYPE
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: type of detection MASKing: can be one of "NONE", "BLANK" or "CORRECT"

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: PIXEL_SCALE
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: size of pixel in arcsec (0=use FITS WCS info)

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: IMAGE_BAND
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: The input image measuerment band. This is used to form the column name in the output VOTable for the measured photometry.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: PARAMETERS_NAME
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: A File containing the list of catalogue paramters that should be computed

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: config_file
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: File containing the main configuration parameters for SExtractor

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: DETECT_MINAREA
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: minimum number of pixels above threshold

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: DetectionImage
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: The image that is used to detect sources. Basic position, shape and size informtaion is derived from this image

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: PhotoImage
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: The Image that is used to measure photometric parameters

content.subject: BPZ
content.description: The software below implements the Bayesian photometric redshift method described in Benitez 2000 .

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: PROBS_LITE
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Save only the final probability distribution

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: PROBS
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Save all the galaxy probability distributions (very large file created)

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: EXCLUDE
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Filters to be excluded from the estimation

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: CHECK
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Perform some checks, compare observed colors with templates, etc.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: ONLY_TYPE
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Use spectroscopic redshifts instead of photo-z

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: NEW_AB
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: If yes, generate new AB files even if they already exist

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: ODDS
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Odds threshold: affects confidence limits definition

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: VERBOSE
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Print estimated redshifts to the standard output

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: INTERP
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Number of interpolated templates between each of the original ones

content.subject: JBORealCEC
content.description: A Commandline Execution Controller that will run most of the applications that Astrogrid has configured/wrapped so far.

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: Query
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: Astronomy Data Query Language that defines the search criteria

cea:ParameterDefinition.name: Format
cea:ParameterDefinition.ceapd:UI_Description: How the results are to be returned. VOTABLE or CSV for now
